item.description: A by-no-means exhaustive list of items we like (especially now that there’s a chill in the air).

item.title: My 10 Favorite Books: Kim Gordon
item.description: The musician and writer shares the titles she’d most want with her on a desert island.
item.author: By KIM GORDON

item.title: A Very Jonathan Adler Hotel
item.description: His banana sculpture is ready for its close-up at the Parker Palm Springs.
item.author: By JOHN WOGAN

item.title: Iggy Pop: Musician, Icon — and Now, Live Nude Model
item.description: In February, the rocker posed nude for a group of students from New York art schools. This week, their portraits open in a show at the Brooklyn Museum.
item.author: By KIN WOO

item.title: Iggy Pop’s Life Drawing Class
item.description: The artist Jeremy Deller organized a live drawing class in which students from art schools around the city drew the music icon.

item.title: The ’90s Designer Making a Big Comeback — All Over the Runways
item.description: Jean Colonna — who launched his business in 1987 — is a spiritual ancestor of some of the most exciting designers currently working.
item.author: By ALEXANDER FURY

item.title: A Photographer’s Homage to an Architect’s Modernist City
item.description: Martien Mulder’s “The City Beautiful” is an exploration of the quiet weight of the relationship between light and space in Le Corbusier-designed Chandigarh, India.
item.author: By CARTER LOVE

item.title: A Healthy Dressing Recipe From L.A.’s Newest Feel-Good Cafe
item.description: Honey Hi combines the best of all the health food trends that have become synonymous with West Coast wellness.
item.author: By CRYSTAL MEERS

item.title: The History of Southern Africa, by Train
item.description: It’s the best way to make sense of the continent’s epic scope, wild splendor and bloody colonial history.
item.author: By TED CONOVER

item.title: Lindsey Adelman on Sharing a Visual Language With Her Husband
item.description: Considering glass sea creature pieces that her then-boyfriend made in 1994, the cult lighting designer offers a glimpse into her world — and marriage.
item.author: As told to EMILY SPIVACK
